text.title: Write About Mental Illness
text.head: Write About Mental Illness
text.p: Writing about serious topics is difficult for those who may have never experienced them . Subjects like mental health can be sensitive for many , making addressing them in an informative essay or a work of fiction a hard thing to do . Here , we discuss what to do when writing about mental health .
text.head: Steps

list.item:
Educate yourself . Find information about the mental illness you want to write about from reputable , authoritative sources in the psychology field .
Ideally , going to professionals who specialize in the mental illness you choose to pursue can help to make your writing factual and understandable for your audience , while still being able to keep an audience hooked on your writing .
Talk to real people with mental illnesses , if possible . People with the ability to give firsthand accounts of mental health experiences are amazing resources for making your piece respectful for those who suffer from the illness . It also can help bring a more personal feeling in your character if you write with the people you talk with in mind . Be respectful of their privacy and any identifying traits or personal stories they share with you .
Do n't be afraid to ask questions . Many people are comfortable talking about the mental disorders they have and will give you a sense of what living with a mental health issue is like . Just be respectful of the person and understand that not everyone wants to share information about this sensitive of a subject .

Figure out what your motive is for incorporating mental health issues in your work . This is particularly important if you 're writing a fictional piece ; remember why you plan to address mental illness .
Many people use mental illnesses to emphasize character traits . For example , a character that is supposed to be angsty might be given depression , but only because it emphasizes the stereotypical depressed individual that the author wants . However , this is an inappropriate use of the illness and is n't seen as respectable in the mental health community .
Do n't let the mental health issue define your character . While someone may suffer from bipolar disorder , that does n't mean that is all they are . Writing a character that is only notable for their illness is a very forced way of incorporating mental health into your book . Characters with mental disorders need to maintain the same level of depth as every other character .

Be precise with your language . Avoid inaccurate or inflammatory words .
Never use words like " retarded " . Words like this often get used a lot in situations where it 's inaccurate and offensive . As an author , you need to be sure to use appropriate terminology and not to use certain words that are seen as offensive . Language evolves as our society changes , and this is especially true for terminology surrounding mental health and disability .
Learn what terms are accepted in the community . Often there are slight nuances to speaking on mental health , and while the distinctions may seem small , they can make your writing less respected by the community . For example , it 's generally not acceptable to say " a schizophrenic " or " a schizophrenic person " . Instead , say " a person with schizophrenia " or " a person who has schizophrenia " .

Be open to changing things . Take feedback from others , including those better versed in the subject you 're writing about or who are directly affected by it .
Even if your overall writing is sound , you may have certain sentences that come off wrong and need fine-tuning . Keeping an open mind on improving things in your writing will make writing a respectful piece much easier .
Understand that people may get upset . Mental health is often a controversial topic , and not everyone agrees on certain aspects . Be understanding , but also know that it is tough to please everyone and that sometimes you ca n't change who gets offended by what .
Always take into account that if you write about discrimination , there may be controversy in whether that should be talked about . However , this controversy is n't necessarily something that you , as an author , need to take personally , as this is an issue bigger than your writing .

text.head: Tips

list.item: Do n't take judgment to heart , but do try to keep multiple perspectives in mind , particularly that of the groups depicted in your work .
Learn to be open to changing things in your writing .

text.head: Warnings

list.item: Trigger warnings may become necessary if you write on subjects of harassment or discrimination based on mental health .
Controversy can lead to a lot of hate against your writing .
